summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 regarding camera system outages at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held. It details technical issues with the surveillance system and planned maintenance work.

persons.name: Christopher Nobile
persons.context: Appears as a sender in the email chain, providing updates on the camera system status and maintenance plans at MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Mentioned as a technician from the company Signet who will be working on the camera system at MCC New York.

connections.description: Christopher Nobile references Jeff from Signet as a technician who will be working on the camera system at MCC New York, indicating a contractor-client or collaborative professional relationship.

events.title: Camera System Status Update
events.description: Christopher Nobile provides a detailed update on the camera system at MCC New York, reporting 161 total cameras, 141-146 currently recording, and 15-20 needing work.

events.title: Daily Camera Outage Report
events.description: A camera report for August 16, 2019, is sent, showing 161 total cameras, 23 outages (14.3% outage rate).

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York had significant issues with its camera surveillance system in August 2019, with 23 out of 161 cameras (14.3%) reported as out of service on August 16.
Technical work was being performed by Jeff from Signet to restore 15-20 non-operational cameras and test the system on generator power.

The document is dated August 16, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and before his death in the same facility on August 10, 2019, highlighting potential security monitoring concerns at the time.
